title: Best Method of Data Collection for a Population Mean
question_text:
Isaac wanted to know the mean number of students in mathematics classes at his small high school.
What is the best way for him to collect his data?

choices.text: Use the number of students in his own mathematics class as a reasonable estimate.

distractor_explanations.B: Choice 'B' is incorrect. There would be no need to take a sample. In addition, a convenience sample is not a good idea since it is unlikely to do a good job of representing the population of interest.
distractor_explanations.C: Choice 'C' is incorrect. The purpose of an experiment is to measure the effects of a certain treatment. There is no treatment involved in this situation. Isaac simply wants to know a population mean.
distractor_explanations.D: Choice 'D' is incorrect. Again, there is no need to use a sample. In addition, Isaac is only interested in the mean number of students in all mathematics classes at his school. He is not interested in finding a mean for different types of math classes so there would be no need to consider different strata.
distractor_explanations.E: Choice 'E' is incorrect. A single observation is not reliable for estimating an overall population mean.
